title: I need to vent.
body:
/vent

Fiora is not Fiora. I had to stop playing my main because she is so disgustingly unfun for both sides.
Yi, Xin, Trynd, Shyv, Udyr, Jax, etc., are abusing rageblade+devourer.
Corki is no longer an ADC. He is a midlaner currently being abused.
Towers are way to weak, minions become way to strong, death timers are way too long.
No one does Herald.
ADC's have too much power. Almost every comp is centered around the ADC.
Lux's kit is unnecessarily safe.
Stop banning Tahm. He is no longer ban worthy, just chill.
Why is tank Akali a thing. Something is wrong.
Kog'Maw feels ruined. He doesn't even need one of his skills, and AP is not an option whatsoever.
Ezreal. Just Ezreal.
Zz'Rot and Banner are being abused because of the sad state of towers.
No one every buys pink wards. No one ever even wards.
Hextech Crafting has been on the PBE for months.
Zhonya's is still terrible, and I don't even midlane.
Fiddlesticks, despite a new item and buffs, is still bad.
Tanks have horrible full build options, while bruisers abuse the few tank items that are good.
What happened to Sword of the Occult.
I still feel that Tiamat should have its passive.

There. I'm not sure if I feel better, but whatevs. If you read this far, I'm done now.

**EDIT:** Some of you guys are giving really good feedback, explaining things, giving opinions, and it's actually amazing to see. This was supposed to just be me venting, and I was having a bad day. Somehow this post got popular, but I guess that's because some people agree. For those of you making those comments, yes I understand the solutions and reasons for most of these, I'm just either still a little grumble-y or antsy about things. Thanks for the comments guys!

Ok im gonna try and break this down a bit.

I'll start with things I agree with you on (sort of):
~Fiora: while I agree that she is in a very strong spot right now, her old ult was disgusting and had literally no counter play in any way shape or form, and he model and everything needed an update anyways (just like many other champs still) A small thing they could do is make her early game a little harder so she needs to play safer which would have laning against her a little easier, otherwise I feel her kit is pretty fair, just gotta learn to out play her.
~Tank Akali: I love me my akali and the whole issue why people are going tank akali is because she currently needs a rework (which she will almost be guaranteed one with the assassin update coming later this year), she's in a spot where if they buff her just a little too much, she will face-roll everyone and if they nerf her just a bit, she cant do anything. Tank akali was born because they buffed her Q energy regen. Its bittersweet to me, because I love seeing people play akali, but its sad that they are using her (majority wise) as a tank when she is meant to be an assassin.

Next, a good amount of your issues is due to just being in a low elo:
~Herald: low elo people tend to not care much about objectives and more towards just killing every champ they see no matter if they die or not because many dont see the big picture.
~Tahm Stench: people in low elo tend to ban the same champs on repeat, reasons why i still see illaoi banned almost every game. 
~Zz'rot and Banner: while good in themselves for split pushing and dividing up enemies, low elo peeps tend to unconsciously play ARAM on summoners rift and always go all mid all the time, thus people have found a way to punish those for doing that.
~Pink wards: need i say more? 

Next, riot is already addressing a good amount on that list as well:
~Devourer is getting nerfed which will help with champs face-rolling before others can get a power spike.
~Lux is being looked at currently (even though she is meant to be a safe Ap caster)
~Kog is getting changed a bit 
~Ezreal just got nerfed (while it was his ult nerf, he also got hurt a bit from Ice Born getting altered a bit)

Next is just random stuff that has changed awhile ago that you are venting about that riot has stated somewhere (too lazy to look up) why they did that change:
~Sword of Occult: While the idea is fun, it was less interactive than its Ap counter part (because Ap's have to use spells to use, not just right click) and it probably was taken out because ADC's got buffed, just like how they removed revive a few months before ekko was released, because it would have been broken.
~Tiamat passive: Which I'm happy about, too many games i've had where i get that item and it forces me to push my wave before i'm ready for it to happen, so this change is actually good.
~Towers and minions and death timers: while I agree there could be a small buff to towers and less death timers, the problem riot was facing is that they didn't want people to always have to commit to a 40+ min game every time they que up, so they have been altering it a bit so it is more fast paced and harder to stall out game. Also for minions change, they deliberately become stronger and push so the team behind doesn't have to venture out so far to get farm to attempt to catch up. 
~Zhonya's was changed to fit in with other ap items so as to make it so not every ap champion under the sun only ever bought the main 3 items, now it is in a place where you buy it when you either want to or need, not because you have to. 

Last but not least:
~Corki: always has been a midlaner, he might be just a tad too bursty as is, but he always has and always will be viable as a bot marksman or midlaner. 
~Hextech crafting is a huge thing coming to the game, it would be absolutely asinine to put something of this scale and not make as perfect as they can, I find that obvious. Its better to wait for something good then to rush something out while its still imperfect. 
~Tanks do not have terrible build options, its just the current meta. This happens. In 3 full moons from now, people will be complaining about how class "X" is broken and class "Y" needs buffs. 


All in all, while I understand that this was just a post to vent about said issues you have, try to separate yourself and view the big picture.  Many of the things here aren't all that bad or are getting fixed currently or in the future.  A lot of this just takes practice to beat, like for me, i despise everything about Morgana but that mainly only comes from the fact that I haven't figured out how to play against her effectively and I refuse to play her to learn that because I'm too stubborn lol. 
If you truly have an issue with something, then post it on the boards politely and talk about options that could be taken to fix said issue. Not just sit and vent on the boards like every other shmuch and their moms, thats what friends are for.

Ok, a few things to note

- Herald.  No one does this at mid-high mmr either.  It's incredibly obvious when top lane leaves to help, Herald deals enough damage where the enemy can probably win a 1v2, and whoever gets the buff is going to get ganked, since they have no control over the lane anymore.  The main reason people go for it is for the 5 devourer stacks.

- Split pushing items.  Again, ZZrot pushes from half a map away.  With death timers being so oppressive, split pushing is relatively safe.  At mid-high mmrs, I'll see most top laners going 1st or 2nd item, and occasionally on the support.

- Tiamat passive.  Top lane typically builds damage if they're ahead, tank if behind.  Tiamat passive allowed for a person to rush the item, but unable to freeze the wave, or not auto-shove it.  Without the AOE, people are able to hold lane better, making it harder for the opponent to come back.  

- "40 minutes," personally, I'm playing a 10min game that takes 20min to end.  You can argue it's shorter, but it's certainly less interactive.  

- Corki became a mid laner after the changes, in part due to his roaming potential, and in part to his new passive, which interacts incredibly well with trinity force.  It's on par with the course, seeing how Quinn and Graves turned out, but still worth noting.

Thank you for the insight into higher elo's.

Tank Akali became a thing because that's the only viable way to play Akali.
IF you play her as assassin glass cannon, the risks are to high for its rewards.
I wouldnt say thats not viable though... I typically (as a lower elo player) tend to have good success on her as full ap.

The thing is, at one point, people learn how to peal and protect their carries.
And the carries learn how to position themselves.

This means that you kind of got to survive for at least 2 dashes. That's why riot is calling her a "hit or miss", "feast or famine", "you need to snowball early". Since if you fail to get feed, the enemy team will be able to easily deny your assassination attempt.
Stuff like Lulu ultimate, exaust. And many others.

However, Akali's ultimate requires her to jump in the enemy lines. Now, if she jumps there and doesn't instantly kill the enemy adc, in the glass cannon build. She will instantly die herself.
Failing her job and losing the game for her team.
While the tank akali's job is: jump in the middle of enemy team and spam E till you die. Doing a lot of AoE damage (think Oriana ultimate) until she dies, while forcing the enemy to use their skills and cooldowns on her.

And Akali is one of the few heroes for which, thornmail first item is viable. Due to the amount of life steal she has. A thornmail + offensive item (even just {{item:3145}} ) means she can dive the enemy adc under his/her turret and score a kill and get out safely with ease.
